thread.title: Liverpool news: Borussia Dortmund to ruin Liverpool transfer plans with £42m striker bid | Metro News
thread.title_full: Liverpool news: Borussia Dortmund to ruin Liverpool transfer plans with £42m striker bid | Metro News

author: Chris Davie For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Liverpool news: Borussia Dortmund to ruin Liverpool transfer plans with £42m striker bid | Metro News
text:
Borussia Dortmund to ruin Liverpool’s transfer plans with £42m bid for Inaki Williams gossip Chris Davie for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 11:11 pm Dortmund are ready to launch a bid for Inaki Williams. (Power Sport Images/Getty Images) 
Borussia Dortmund are weighing up a €50 million (£42.5m) offer for Athletic Bilbao striker Inaki Williams, according to reports in Spain. 
Radio Marca claim that 22-year-old is one of Dortmund’s ‘great goals’ ahead of the summer transfer window and the club are prepared to activate the forward’s hefty release clause. 
Liverpool have also been heavily linked with a move for Williams, with reports in Italy claiming that Jurgen Klopp’s side are also ready to trigger the striker’s release clause at the end of the campaign . Williams has been heavily linked with a move to Liverpool. (Urbanandsport/NurPhoto/Getty Images) 
Williams, who primarily plays on Bilbao’s right flank but is also capable of filling in as a striker, has five goals and five assists in 32 appearances for the Basque club this term. 
When asked about Liverpool’s reported interest earlier this month, Williams admitted he would be open to a move to Anfield. 
‘If [Liverpool] are looking at me it’s because I’m doing things well. I’m very lucky,’ he told Sportium.
